DOC.brief_summary: Background Previous study great discrepancy concern effect quadriceps contraction patellar lateral displacement tilt patient patellofemoral pain syndrome . This discrepancy may cause lack information regard classification patellofemoral alignment quadriceps relax . We hypothesize quadriceps contraction different effect type patellofemoral malalignment . Methods The investigator expect recruit 150 subject patellofemoral pain syndrome participate study . All patient underwent compute tomography image symptomatic knee , without quadriceps muscle contraction 0° , 15° 30° knee flexion . Patellar lateral condyle index patellar tilt angle Sasaki modify Fulkerson measure investigate effect quadriceps contraction patellar repositioning .
DOC.brief_title: The Role Quadriceps Contraction Patellar Repositioning - Computed Tomography Study
DOC.detailed_description: Background Previous study great discrepancy concern effect quadriceps contraction patellar lateral displacement tilt patient patellofemoral pain syndrome . This discrepancy may cause lack information regard classification patellofemoral alignment quadriceps relax . We hypothesize quadriceps contraction different effect type patellofemoral malalignment . We expect recruit 150 subject patellofemoral pain syndrome participate study . All patient underwent compute tomography image symptomatic knee , without quadriceps muscle contraction 0° , 15° 30° knee flexion . Patellar lateral condyle index patellar tilt angle Sasaki modify Fulkerson measure investigate effect quadriceps contraction patellar repositioning .
DOC.criteria: The inclusion criterion patient PFPS suffer pain least two kind kneeflexing activity : sit get sit walk upstairs downstairs squat get squat run kneel jump The exclusion criterion include : The presence major medical disease Rheumatoid arthritis , gouty arthritis Recent history ( within 3 month ) knee surgery Image finding osteoarthritis Any deformity low limb
